results.deck: After separating from her friend Lee, young orphan Clementine must survive through the undead apocalypse with a new roaming group of survivors in this sequel to Telltale's original five-part adventure based on the comic book The Walking Dead.
results.name: The Walking Dead: Season Two

results.deck: A true sequel and new installment in the BlazBlue franchise, taking place after the events of Continuum Shift.
results.name: BlazBlue: Chrono Phantasma

results.deck: The continuation of the saga of the battling elemental students of San Bruno High School.
results.name: Battle High 2

results.deck: The third entry in the Super Mario Bros inspired platformer series.
results.name: Giana Sisters: Twisted Dreams

results.deck: George and Nico return for the fifth game in Charles Cecil's Broken Sword franchise. They embark on an all new adventure that involves an investigation into an armed raid on a Paris gallery. Partially funded by Kickstarter.
results.name: Broken Sword: The Serpent's Curse

results.deck: The stand-alone prelude to Metal Gear Solid V: The Phantom Pain, giving players a taste of the new open-world gameplay mechanics while setting up the main game's story, as Snake (Big Boss) must infiltrate a prison camp to rescue his comrades.
results.name: Metal Gear Solid V: Ground Zeroes

results.deck: 1001 Spikes is a "masocore" platformer where the player is given 1001 lives to complete the game.
results.name: 1001 Spikes

results.deck: A roguelike exploration/survival game from the creators of Shank and Mark of the Ninja.
results.name: Don't Starve

results.deck: While investigating a mass murder, Detective Sebastian Castellanos descends into a gruesome, nightmarish world. This third-person survival horror game marks the debut of Tango Gameworks, a studio headed by Resident Evil progenitor Shinji Mikami.
results.name: The Evil Within

results.deck: Slender: The Arrival is a horror adventure game. It is the first official sequel to Slender: The Eight Pages.
results.name: Slender: The Arrival

results.deck: Two brothers are on a search for a cure for their dying father.
results.name: Brothers: A Tale of Two Sons

results.deck: Oddworld: Abe's Oddysee New 'n' Tasty is a remake of the original Oddworld game, Abe's Oddysee.
results.name: Oddworld: Abe's Oddysee New 'n' Tasty!

results.deck: The popular science fiction film franchise crosses over into Angry Birds territory.
results.name: Angry Birds: Star Wars

results.deck: Deep within the abandoned halls of Mount Massive Asylum, amateur journalist Miles Upshur sets out to find a good story, and instead finds an evil presence.
results.name: Outlast

results.deck: High-definition remake of the 2010 Genesis RPG.
results.name: Pier Solar and the Great Architects

results.deck: The third entry in WayForward's Shantae series, and the first to see a release on home consoles. Shantae is forced to work with her archenemy Risky Boots to stop an even more evil pirate.
results.name: Shantae and the Pirate's Curse

results.deck: The fourth entry in the Elite franchise, from the series' co-creator David Braben and Frontier Developments.
results.name: Elite: Dangerous

results.deck: Nightmares From The Deep: The Cursed Heart is a hidden objects game.
results.name: Nightmares From The Deep: The Cursed Heart

results.deck: The fifth entry in the Metal Gear Solid series recounts the adventures of Punished 'Venom' Snake, as he wakes up from a nine-year coma in 1984 to rebuild his mercenary paradise.
results.name: Metal Gear Solid V: The Phantom Pain

results.deck: Blood, souls, and tears are continually spent as players traverse the land of Drangleic in FromSoftware's third entry in the Souls series.
results.name: Dark Souls II

results.deck: This enhanced remake of the original Binding of Isaac features expanded gameplay, pixel art visuals, and a variety of other new additions - including full controller support and local asymmetric co-op.
results.name: The Binding of Isaac: Rebirth

results.deck: The denizens of the Marvel Universe battle it out LEGO style.
results.name: LEGO Marvel Super Heroes

results.deck: A 2-player co-op micro-platformer where the players must control a pink spaceship by interacting with systems inside of the ship.
results.name: Lovers in a Dangerous Spacetime

results.deck: Evolve is a class-based cooperative-competitive game in which a team of four hunters chase after an evolving monster, also controlled by a player.
results.name: Evolve

results.deck: Celebrating 25 years of John Madden Football. No correlation to the year 2025.
results.name: Madden NFL 25

results.deck: CD Projekt RED's third Witcher combines the series' non-linear storytelling with a sprawling open world that concludes the saga of Geralt of Rivia.
results.name: The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt

results.deck: Yank the top half of a Skylanders toy off of its base and connect it to a different bottom half to make new combinations in the third Skylanders game.
results.name: Skylanders SWAP Force

results.deck: The sixth main installment of the Assassin's Creed franchise, set in the Caribbean during the age of piracy in the early 18th century. Players explore the memories of Edward Kenway, a charismatic pirate (turned reckless Assassin) and the grandfather of Connor Kenway, the protagonist of Assassin's Creed III.
results.name: Assassin's Creed IV: Black Flag

results.deck: The tenth installment of the long-running shooter franchise introduces a brand new storyline, where the United States is under threat from a coalition of South American nations, and must employ a special group of operatives known as "Ghosts" to survive.
results.name: Call of Duty: Ghosts

results.deck: A supernatural mystery game in which Ronan OConnor, deceased detective, tries to solve his own murder.
results.name: Murdered: Soul Suspect

results.deck: A rhythm-based platformer made in the spare time of the lead gameplay designer at Playdead.
There Came an Echo is a squad-based strategy game that relies heavily on voice commands. It was developed by Iridium Studios.
results.name: There Came an Echo

results.deck: Action-RPG from NostalgiCO, successfully kickstarted on February 26, 2013. ATLUS will be publishing the game in Summer 2016.
results.name: Cryamore

results.deck: A sequel to the first Blood Bowl. A game based on the Games Workshop table top mini figures game of the same name that pits fantasy races from the Warhammer universe against one another in turn-based American football.
results.name: Blood Bowl 2

results.deck: Drink sodas in various areas to win while collecting bonus sodas and contemplating the power of soda.
results.name: Soda Drinker Pro

results.deck: In Sniper Elite III, players once again take on the role of World War II sniper Karl Fairburne, this time as he travels to Northern Africa to uncover a secret Nazi plot.
results.name: Sniper Elite III

results.deck: 1-4 player Tactical Arena Co-Op game, funded via Kickstarter.
results.name: Forced

results.deck: A 2D Side Scrolling Platforming developed by Press Play for the Xbox 360, Xbox One and PC.
results.name: Max: The Curse of Brotherhood

results.deck: A platformer that takes inspiration from both Super Hexagon and Super Meat Boy. The game tasks players with ending the tyrannical rule of the Groove-Wizard.
results.name: Electronic Super Joy

results.deck: Renegade Kid's new episodic Horror-FPS originally planned for the Nintendo 3DS eShop. On April 2, 2014 Renegade Kid announced the game was evolved into a console game and went to Kickstarter while the 3DS version has been canceled. The game will be made even if the Kickstarter fails but it will take a lot longer, according to Renegade Kid.
results.name: Cult County

results.deck: An action-platformer paying homage to 8-bit classics like Mega Man and Castlevania. It is developed by a small group of former WayForward employees, with funding through Kickstarter.
results.name: Shovel Knight

results.deck: A PlayStation Vita exclusive puzzle platformer where the game world is made out of infographics representing statistics about the player's current gameplay session.
results.name: Metrico

results.deck: An upcoming turn-based RPG from AckkStudios.
results.name: YIIK: A Postmodern RPG

results.deck: A sequel to the 2011 WiiWare sidescrolling action game, funded through Kickstarter. Now it's a 3D Action RPG.
results.name: Anima - Gate of Memories

results.deck: 6180 the moon is a puzzle-platformer in which players control the Moon as it sets off to find the missing Sun.
results.name: 6180 the moon

results.deck: A fast-paced shooter with some rogue-like elements. It is developed mostly by Joe Mirabello, an ex-employee of 38 Studios.
results.name: Tower of Guns

results.deck: Super Mega Baseball is a arcade-style simulation baseball game from Metalhead Software.
results.name: Super Mega Baseball

results.deck: A tough-as-nails, retro-styled action game published by Adult Swim.
results.name: Volgarr the Viking

results.deck: Trace a safe route to help a ninja squirrel pick up power-ups and avoid enemies in a modern Pac-Man.
results.name: Nutjitsu

results.deck: A touch-based side-scrolling platformer.
results.name: Badland

results.deck: The 2014 installment in EA Canada's soccer simulation franchise. This was the first in the franchise to bridge the 360/PS3 to Xbox One/PS4 gap.
results.name: FIFA 14

results.deck: A third-person action-adventure game set in a medieval world populated with animals. Created by Lionel Gallat, a former Dreamworks animator and recently Universal Studios animation director (Despicable Me, The Lorax).
results.name: Ghost of a Tale

results.deck: Fight for the survival of mankind against the armies of Hell.
results.name: Hellraid

results.deck: Dungeon RPG from Experience and Kadokawa Games.
results.name: Stranger of Sword City

results.deck: The latest entry in the venerable shooter franchise takes place in a version of the 1960s in which the Nazis have established a global empire after winning World War II. Protagonist B.J. Blazkowicz fights for an underground resistance movement, outnumbered and outgunned by high-tech Nazi forces.
results.name: Wolfenstein: The New Order

results.deck: A cross-gen open-world driving game set in a fictional Redview County.
results.name: Need for Speed Rivals

results.deck: Road Redemption is a Kickstarter-funded spiritual sequel to Road Rash. Motorcycle-combat-racing for a new generation.
results.name: Road Redemption

results.deck: Legendary, quick-witted swordsman Lo Wang returns to fight demonic forces in this total re-imagining of 3D Realms's 1997 Asian-themed first-person shooter of the same name.
results.name: Shadow Warrior

results.deck: Earthlock: Festival of Magic is an episodic RPG adventure with harvesting and crafting along with PVP mechanics.
results.name: Earthlock: Festival Of Magic

results.deck: The fifteenth installment of 2K Sports' basketball sim arrives just in time for the 2013-14 NBA season.
results.name: NBA 2K14

results.deck: An indie puzzle platformer game by Nowhere Studios.
results.name: Monochroma

results.deck: An indie action game for PC, Mac, and Linux that melds fast-paced first-person shooting with the random levels and permanent death of roguelikes.
results.name: Paranautical Activity

results.deck: A retro-style 2D skateboarding game inspired by the Tony Hawk franchise.
results.name: OlliOlli

results.deck: Puzzle-platformer staring anthropomorphic rodent Ethan, who can stop time and manipulate the environment with his mind.
results.name: Ethan: Meteor Hunter

results.deck: A fantasy action-RPG developed by CI Games and Deck 13 for PC, PlayStation 4, and Xbox One. The protagonist, convicted and ostracized for his crimes by a draconian society, is called upon to stop an army of demons commanded by a god who was long ago overthrown.
results.name: Lords of the Fallen

results.deck: Forza Motorsport's debut on the Xbox One.
results.name: Forza Motorsport 5

results.deck: UFC comes to next-gen platforms via EA SPORTS.
results.name: EA Sports UFC

results.deck: A game that blurs the line between television and gaming. The game follows protagonists Jack Joyce and Beth Wilder, while the television show follows the game's antagonist Paul Serene. Both make up Quantum Break: a time travel mystery developed by Remedy Entertainment for Xbox One and PC.
results.name: Quantum Break

results.deck: Dying Light is a first-person, open world game set in a zombie apocalypse. The player character is able to free-run to get around the environment quickly.
results.name: Dying Light

results.deck: This entry in the Zumba dance game series has an international theme to its song list.
results.name: Zumba Fitness: World Party

results.deck: Wonder Flick is a treasure-hunting RPG from Level-5 for iOS and Android.
results.name: Wonder Flick

results.deck: A single-player turn-based tactical strategy game developed by Double Fine Productions.
results.name: Massive Chalice

results.deck: Billed as "a genealogical Rogue-lite", Rogue Legacy is an indie 2D side-scrolling mash-up of Metroidvania platforming and Rougelike perma-death, as players build up a knight's lineage by exploring the procedurally-generated Castle Hamson while collecting gold, attempting to defeat bosses, and dying (many times, with each death bringing forth a new descendent).
results.name: Rogue Legacy

results.deck: Inspired by the classic Walt Disney's Fantasia, Disney Fantasia: Music Evolved gives you control of the beat and rhythm of music through motion.
results.name: Disney Fantasia: Music Evolved

results.deck: A top-down shooter set between the events of Halo 3 and Halo 4, Halo: Spartan Assault details the first Spartan Ops missions of the UNSC SPARTAN-IV Program.
results.name: Halo: Spartan Assault

results.deck: Platforming adventure about Ray, who awakens from a coma with a 16 foot pink spaghetti arm sticking out of his head and discovers that The Man is literally out to get him.
results.name: Stick It to the Man!

results.deck: Set in a far-flung, mech-filled future, Titanfall is the first first-person shooter built by Respawn Entertainment, the studio formed by ex-employees of Call of Duty developer Infinity Ward.
results.name: Titanfall

results.deck: EA's revival of the NBA Live series that followed several years of cancellations and false starts. It was released exclusively on the new generation of PlayStation 4 and Xbox One hardware.
results.name: NBA Live 14

results.deck: An enhanced version of the first person puzzle game, Q.U.B.E., for PC, PS3, Wii U and Xbox One with an all-new story, new puzzles and a new Time Trial mode.
results.name: Q.U.B.E. Director's Cut

results.deck: Plants and Zombies are once again pitted against each other in this class-based third-person shooter developed by Popcap Games.
results.name: Plants vs. Zombies: Garden Warfare

results.deck: Kinect Sports makes its debut on the Xbox One.
results.name: Kinect Sports: Rivals

results.deck: After 17 years on hiatus, the original combo-heavy fighting game franchise returns as a free-to-play launch title for the Xbox One.
results.name: Killer Instinct

results.deck: The latest energy drink, OverCharge Delirium XT, has turned Sunset City into an energy drink-fueled mutant apocalypse and it is up to you to survive in Insomniac Games' Xbox One exclusive.
results.name: Sunset Overdrive

results.deck: Headed by "Swery" (creator of the 2010 cult-classic Deadly Premonition), D4 is an episodic adventure game following the surreal mystery of David Young, a private detective with the power to "dive" into past events in order to investigate the murder of his wife.
results.name: D4: Dark Dreams Don't Die

results.deck: A free-to-play content creation sandbox game where players can generate their own miniature games, for the Xbox One, Xbox 360, and PC.
results.name: Project Spark

results.deck: Escape from the zombie-infested city of Los Perdidos, California in the third installment of Capcom's Dead Rising franchise.
results.name: Dead Rising 3

results.deck: A minimalist action-adventure game by Capy for Xbox One and PC, incorporating elements of both roguelikes and discovery-driven games.
results.name: Below

results.deck: Eight months after the events of Halo 4, the Master Chief has reunited with his former SPARTAN-II comrades to form Blue Team. After they go AWOL on a personal mission, a team of SPARTAN-IVs known as Fireteam Osiris is assigned to hunt them down and bring back the Master Chief.
results.name: Halo 5: Guardians

results.deck: A downloadable golf game developed by Zoe Mode for the Xbox One.
results.name: Powerstar Golf

results.deck: The new title in Ubisoft's hugely successful dance game franchise.
results.name: Just Dance 2014

results.deck: The original zoo-management game returns as a console title (for the Xbox 360 and Xbox One), allowing players to build functioning zoos, to keep animals and guests happy, and to drive around their zoo in a magic buggy. Beep beep.
results.name: Zoo Tycoon

results.deck: The long-awaited sequel to Peggle from PopCap.
results.name: Peggle 2

results.deck: The follow-up to the Battlefront games of the PS2/Xbox era. Now being developed by DICE and published by EA.
results.name: Star Wars Battlefront

results.deck: The second edition of Rocksmith from Ubisoft features a new soundtrack, enhancements to the user interface, and a slew of new games and lessons aimed at helping learn how to play the guitar.
results.name: Rocksmith 2014

results.deck: A single-player and cooperative driving game that takes place throughout the United States, developed by Ivory Tower.
results.name: The Crew

results.deck: RedLynx takes their bike-platforming franchise to the future (and PlayStation) with the addition of a physics-based trick system.
results.name: Trials Fusion

results.deck: An online-only open-world shooter-RPG from Ubisoft Massive set in a chaotic New York City that is wrought by disease.
results.name: Tom Clancy's The Division

results.deck: The third sequentially numbered title in the Kingdom Hearts franchise; it was revealed during the 2013 Sony E3 press conference.
results.name: Kingdom Hearts III

results.deck: An open world action game with an emphasis on vehicular combat, based on the Mad Max character from the series of Australian post-apocalyptic films by George Miller.
results.name: Mad Max

results.deck: A persistent MMORPG set in the Warhammer 40k Universe and developed by Behaviour Interactive.
results.name: Warhammer 40,000: Eternal Crusade
